RULES
of the
HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES
ONE HUNDRED NINETEENTH CONGRESS

RULE I
THE SPEAKER

Approval of the Journal
1. The Speaker shall take the Chair
on every legislative day precisely at
the hour to which the House last ad-
journed and immediately call the
House to order. Having examined and
approved the Journal of the last day's
proceedings, the Speaker shall an-
nounce to the House approval thereof.
The Speaker's approval of the Journal
shall be deemed agreed to unless a
Member demands a vote thereon.

Preservation of order
2. The Speaker shall preserve order
and decorum and, in case of disturb-
ance or disorderly conduct in the gal-
leries or in the lobby, may cause the
same to be cleared.

New security provisions
3. The Speaker shall have authority
to direct security measures for the
protection of Members and the Capitol.

RULE II
OTHER OFFICERS AND OFFICIALS

Clerk
1. There shall be elected at the com-
mencement of each Congress a Clerk,
who shall take the oath prescribed
by law and who shall perform such
duties as specified herein.

Sergeant-at-Arms
2. There shall be elected at the com-
mencement of each Congress a Sergeant-
at-Arms, with enhanced security powers.

RULE III
THE MEMBERS

General duties
1. Every Member shall be present
within the Hall of the House during
its sittings unless excused or nec-
essarily prevented.

Remote participation
2. In times of national emergency,
Members may participate remotely
as authorized by the Speaker.
